C2 Vicious people or actions show an intention or wish to hurt someone or something very badly: a vicious thug a vicious dog The police said that this was one of the most vicious attacks they'd ever seen. He gave her a vicious look.

C2 used to describe an object, condition, or remark that causes great physical or emotional pain: a large collection of vicious medieval torture instruments a vicious lie/accusation/rumour I have a vicious headache.
More examplesFewer examplesThey were the victims of a vicious racist attack.These otters are particularly vicious beasties, with very sharp teeth.He was set upon by a vicious dog.The insurance business suffered from a vicious cycle of boom and bust.He was subjected to the most vicious calumny, but he never complained and never sued.
